result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob Neal Jason Ziller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob Neal Jason Ziller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob Neal Jason Ziller was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Court dismisses 15CM241.
Defendant to report to Probation today September 28, 2015 by 3:00 p.m.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Continue with current payment plan.
DNA surcharge.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by Agent.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann   DF:  Jacob Neal Jason Ziller appeared. Includes 15CM241 and 15CM300. Case called at 2:06 pm. ADA Correll recites agreement. No objection from Atty Amann.  Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one in 15CM300, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of Count one in 15CM300. Court dismisses all other counts. Parties make sentencing arguements. Def makes statement. Court orders 1 yr probation w/h with conditions:
- 30 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs
- DNA Surcharge; Apply Bond
- AODA
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Restorative Justice if requested
- Sign up for probation by 9/28/2015
- Random UA's and PBT's
- Pay Supervision Fees.
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
Eligible for Expungement if probation completed successfully.  Probation review hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
